driving_tips.title: Maintain Optimal Speed
driving_tips.description: Drive at 60-80 kmph on highways for maximum CNG efficiency. Speeds above 100 kmph can reduce efficiency by 20-30%.

driving_tips.title: Smooth Acceleration
driving_tips.description: Avoid sudden acceleration and hard braking. Gradual speed changes can improve fuel efficiency significantly.

driving_tips.title: Proper Tire Pressure
driving_tips.description: Check tire pressure monthly. Under-inflated tires increase rolling resistance and reduce efficiency by 3-5%.

driving_tips.title: Reduce Idle Time
driving_tips.description: Turn off engine if waiting more than 1 minute. Idling wastes fuel and increases emissions.

driving_tips.title: Use AC Wisely
driving_tips.description: AC usage can reduce efficiency by 10-15%. Use it judiciously and prefer windows at low speeds.

driving_tips.title: Regular Service
driving_tips.description: Service your CNG vehicle every 5,000 km or 6 months. Regular maintenance ensures optimal performance.

driving_tips.title: CNG Filter Replacement
driving_tips.description: Replace CNG filter every 10,000-15,000 km. Clogged filters reduce engine performance and efficiency.

driving_tips.title: Check Spark Plugs
driving_tips.description: Inspect and replace spark plugs every 20,000 km. Worn plugs reduce combustion efficiency.

driving_tips.title: CNG Kit Inspection
driving_tips.description: Get CNG kit inspected annually by authorized centers. Check for leaks, pressure regulators, and valves.

driving_tips.title: Engine Oil Quality
driving_tips.description: Use manufacturer-recommended oil. Good quality oil reduces friction and improves engine life.

driving_tips.title: Regular Leak Checks
driving_tips.description: Check for CNG leaks monthly. Apply soap water on connections and look for bubbles.

driving_tips.title: Cylinder Hydrotesting
driving_tips.description: Get CNG cylinder hydrotested every 3 years as per regulations. This ensures structural integrity.

driving_tips.title: Ventilation Parking
driving_tips.description: Park in well-ventilated areas. Avoid basement parking if possible due to gas being lighter than air.

driving_tips.title: Compare Station Prices
driving_tips.description: CNG prices can vary by â‚¹2-5 per kg between stations. Use app to find cheaper options.

driving_tips.title: Off-Peak Refueling
driving_tips.description: Refuel during off-peak hours to avoid long queues and save time.

driving_tips.title: Trip Planning
driving_tips.description: Combine multiple errands into one trip. Better route planning reduces overall fuel consumption.

driving_tips.title: Carpooling
driving_tips.description: Share rides for regular commutes. Reduces per-person cost and environmental impact.

driving_tips.title: Reduce Load
driving_tips.description: Remove unnecessary weight from vehicle. Every 50 kg reduces efficiency by 1-2%.

driving_tips.title: Regular Emission Checks
driving_tips.description: Get emission tests done during servicing. CNG vehicles should have minimal emissions.

driving_tips.title: Eco-Driving Mode
driving_tips.description: Use eco-mode if available. It optimizes engine performance for better efficiency.

cng_facts.title: Cost Savings
cng_facts.description: CNG costs 50-60% less than petrol, saving â‚¹40,000-60,000 annually for average users.

cng_facts.title: Environmental Benefits
cng_facts.description: CNG reduces CO2 emissions by 25%, NOx by 70%, and particulate matter by 95% compared to diesel.

cng_facts.title: Engine Life
cng_facts.description: CNG burns cleaner, reducing engine wear and potentially extending engine life by 20-30%.

cng_facts.title: Safety
cng_facts.description: CNG is lighter than air and disperses quickly. Tanks undergo rigorous safety testing.

cng_facts.title: Performance
cng_facts.description: Modern CNG kits maintain 95-98% of original engine performance with proper tuning.

cng_facts.title: Range
cng_facts.description: Typical CNG tank provides 200-300 km range. Sequential kits allow seamless petrol backup.

daily: Observe any unusual sounds or smells
weekly: Clean air filter if dusty conditions
monthly: Detailed leak check with soap water
Check all fluid levels (oil, coolant, brake fluid)
every_6_months: Replace engine oil and oil filter
every_3_years: Replace all CNG hoses and connections

common_issues.issue: Engine Starts on Petrol but Not CNG

causes: CNG doesn't vaporize well in cold
solutions: Start on petrol, switch after warm-up

practices: Don't wait for tank to be completely empty
Ensure proper cylinder closure after filling

myths_vs_facts.myth: CNG vehicles are unsafe and prone to explosions
myths_vs_facts.fact: CNG is one of the safest fuels. Cylinders undergo rigorous testing at 300+ bar pressure. CNG disperses quickly being lighter than air.
Modern sequential kits maintain 95-98% of original power. Any loss is negligible for regular driving.
CNG actually extends engine life by 20-30% due to cleaner combustion and less carbon deposits.

myths_vs_facts.myth: CNG conversion is not worth it for less usage
myths_vs_facts.fact: Break-even typically achieved in 8-15 months even with moderate usage of 1200-1500 km/month.

myths_vs_facts.myth: CNG quality varies significantly between stations
myths_vs_facts.fact: All CNG stations follow strict quality standards. Variations are minimal and regulated by government.

myths_vs_facts.myth: CNG vehicles can't be used in cold weather
myths_vs_facts.fact: Modern CNG systems work well in cold weather. Simple practice is to start on petrol and switch after warm-up.
